title: Design of Online/Distributed Learning Environments Centered on Mathematical Problem-Solving: Applying Freirean Assessment Principles

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level mathematics theory (equations, statistics, graph interpretation) and hands-on experience in educational assessment
context.additional_context: Strengthening mathematics education assessment competencies for elementary education managers/leaders in corporate settings, with a focus on developing evaluation tools for computational skills, problem-solving strategies, and data analysis.

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three learner-engaged formative assessment designs in the mathematical problem-solving process by applying Freirean evaluation principles.
Learners can develop at least two equation- and statistical analysis-based assessment tools that promote critical reflection in mathematics education settings.
Learners can design a formative assessment process for measuring understanding of mathematical concepts through collaboration with peers and establish an implementation plan.

Learners can use personal devices (BYOD) to write a reflective blog twice monthly on the mathematical problem-solving process (e.g., graph interpretation, probability calculation), receive at least three specific feedbacks from peers/instructors, and submit an improved report reflecting the revisions within two weeks.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
